main event: A yellowish-white light, resembling a star and the size of Venus, was observed approaching head on over Plainville, Kansas on October 19, 1959.
interesting points: The light gained in size as it approached and faded out when evasive action was taken., The sighting lasted for about 2-3 minutes., The flight path of the light changed course after initially being straight and level., Observers noted that the light showed no characteristics of a conventional aircraft., The report concluded that the sighting remains unidentified and may have been a reflection or meteorological phenomenon.
sighted object: a yellowish-white light like a star
witness description: the sighting was viewed from an aircraft
